::Spears::

Her maximal programming was fighting harder than ever to get rid of 
the trainer program.  In her sleep, she saw the fighting between the 
trainers and the maximals. She saw her, walking along the path with 
Striker. She remembered that happy time. Then she saw the trainers 
come and hurt Striker, putting the chip on her and taking them 
hostage. She grew angry. Not that she had lost her herself in all 
this, but that she was robbed of her identity. She grew more and more 
angry. Her internal curciuts started running in high gear as her 
emotion chips were helping to figt back the trainer program. In her 
spark, she rememebred that she was a maximals and she needed to fight 
as a maximal.  The insignia on her shoulder glowed slightly as she 
tried to help her programs fight the traimer program. She was a 
maximal and wanted to stay one. 


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> ::Prowl/Kluster/Firearm::
> 
> "Iron Raptor, wait!" Prowl yells, running out of his room and down 
> the hall after Iron Raptor. His disabled arm and bleeding chest 
> didn't help his speed at all.
> 
> He swears under his breath as he runs after his love, hoping she 
> didn't go through any more doors. He didn't know what it took to 
set 
> the autoguns off, and he hoped he wouldn't have to find out anytime 
> soon.
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Kluster nods. "That would be Iron Raptor, one second," he replies 
to 
> Child, walking over to the closest console.
> 
> "Computer, locate unit Iron Raptor," he says, the computer scanning 
> the CF and as far as the scanners reached, which was very far.
> 
> "Unit Iron Raptor not in scanner range," it replied. Iron Raptor's 
> bizzarre third beast mode didn't register on the Cybertronian 
Fire's 
> scanners as Iron Raptor.
> 
> Kluster frowns, turning back to Child. "Guess it's me then," he 
> says, "What do you need?"
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Firearm frowns as Spears' body begins to shake, about to put 
another 
> one of the stasis lock devices on her when he pauses, looking down 
at 
> her. He was thinking of a moment many years back, a moment that had 
> marked the beginning of his service in the Maximal military.
> 
> (Flashback)
> 
> He was strapped to a table, energon beams holding his arms, legs, 
and 
> head in place. He could remember himself yelling for them to let 
him 
> go and fight like real bots, but they had only laughed. They were 
> terrorists, going from planet to planet and massacuring colonies. 
> Firearm, one of the defenders of a neutral colony that they had 
> attacked, was the only one left, and they were about to torture him.
> 
> Suddenly, the door blew in, Kluster, Rex, Proto, and a group of 
other 
> Maximals rushing in, weapons leveled at the chests of the 
terrorists.
> 
> "You're under arrest," Kluster said, looking in disgust at the 
> leader, "Charged with murder. You can give us your weapons and go 
> peacefully, or we can blast you to little pieces and take you back 
to 
> Cybertron that way."
> 
> The terrorist laughed, "Maximals are putting me under arrest? How 
> about we use your pieces for scrap!"
> 
> The terrorist brought up his rifle, firing a shot at Kluster's 
chest. 
> The Maximal ducked, firing back at the terrorist.
> 
> A second later, the room was filled with gunfire and the sound of  
> fighting. A stay shot hit Firearm's table, the energon beams 
shorting 
> out. The bot jumped up, looking around for the terrorist leader.
> 
> A second later, all the gunfire and fighting stopped as a loud 
> explosion filled the room, the bots in it looking at the center to 
> see a black spot occupying the space where the terrorist leader had 
> once stood, his body now laying motionlessly against a wall. An 
angry 
> looking Firearm stood on the table that he had been strapped to, 
his 
> cannon smoking.
> 
> The terrorists dropped their weapons.
> 
> (End Flashback)
> 
> Firearm shakes his head, returning to reality. He looks down at 
> Spears, frowning. Kluster had let him choose what side he wanted to 
> be on, teaching him the good and bad points of both. He was sure 
that 
> even if he had chosen Predacon, Kluster would have remained his 
> friend and would have helped him in any way he could.
> 
> Firearm puts the stasis lock device on Spears. Every bot deserved a 
> choice, but their minds would have to be clear. Firearm would 
remove 
> the trainer chip, and then he'd let Spears choose, Trainer or 
Maximal.
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
